ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Test of ...
ygData.msgSnippet: 1) You really can t require much of guides at all. They are volunteers. Doing events is not part of the volunteering contract. 2) it is not that easy to move a
ygData.messageBody:
1) You really can't require much of guides at all. They are volunteers.
Doing events is not part of the volunteering contract.

2) it is not that easy to move a guide from one server to another. I've
got a friend who is a cross-server GUide. She took a while to get set up
on them. Its a special case when a Guide is a "SWAT" Guide and can do
such things on more than one server.

Events are already staggered between servers. Each server decides for
itself when its going to hold an event, and makes the planning, etc.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4
>Sent: Tuesday, June 06, 2000 3:16 PM

>But if Verant is planning a special event then it should be fairly easy for
>them to require all/most of that server's GMs/guides to be online at the
>time of the event . Plus if they are short GM/guides then they can stagger
>the events between servers and have GM/guides from one server temporarily
>move over to another one to help out with the event until its over.
